title: Cast Iron Monkey Bread Pizookie
directions: Mix together the flour, baking powder, salt, milk, and 2 tbsp melted butter until a soft and pliable dough forms. Tear off small chunks and roll into about 1-inch balls.
Stir cinnamon and granulated sugar together in a small bowl. Dip each dough ball into melted butter, then coat in the cinnamon-sugar mix.
Arrange coated dough balls evenly in a greased 8-10 inch cast iron skillet.
Melt the glaze ingredients together (brown sugar + butter + optional vanilla) and drizzle over the top.
Bake for 18-22 minutes until bubbling and golden.
Let cool for 3-5 minutes, then top with scoops of coffee ice cream.
notes: For extra decadence, add chocolate chips between the dough balls before baking. Consider an espresso glaze or caramel drizzle on top. This is a sharing-size version scaled up from the single-serve ramekin recipe.
